u1c9b.La Basilica di San Giovanni in Laterano,: The Basilica of Saint John Lateran, defined “Mater et Caput” of all the churches in Rome and in the world, is the Cathedral of Rome and the episcopal seat of the Holy Father.
u1c9b.Scoprirete il Complesso del Laterano che: You'll discover the Lateran Complex, which comprehends more than one place of great interest: the Basilica and the Cloister, the Baptistery, and the Holy Stairs with the “Sancta Sanctorum” Papal Chapel.
u1c9b.Sarà un viaggio alla scoperta della stor: Discovery the beauty and the history of one of the most evocative places in Rome!

u1f97.La Basilica di Santa Maria in via Lata è: The Basilica Santa Maria in via Lata preserves the memory of an important piece of the two thousand year history of Christianity in the Eternal City.
u1f97.Fondata su origini molto antiche, la chi: Founded atop ancient origins, the church was built over an earlier church from the 7th or 8th century, and eventually was given a baroque style. According to tradition, the Apostles Peter and Paul dwelt here during the years of their imprisonment in Rome.
u1f97.Nei sotterranei sono ancora visibili i r: In the crypt, remains of a large Roman period edifice are still visible; in the 7th century, it was transformed into a place of worship.

u1f81.DI SANTA MARIA IN VIA LATA: OF SANTA MARIA IN VIA LATA

u2370.Basilica di Santa Maria in via Lata: Basilica Santa Maria in Via Lata

u2217.Il Carcer Tullianum, uno dei monumenti a: The Carcer Tullianum is one of the most fascinating archeological monuments from the era of the Roman republic. It contains a wealth of art, archeology and history. It has also become a place of Christian worship, and is situated beneath the church of Saint Joseph of the Carpenters. And seeing that it faces the Roman Forum, it offers one of the most evocative views of ancient Rome. With the assistance of some of the most recent technologies, you will discover the place where, according to tradition, Saint Peter was imprisoned.

u2472.Questa visita vi porterà ad ammirare l’e: During this visit, you will be able to admire the exceptional historical stratification, which tells us about every day life in ancient Rome and its development over time.
u2472.Il Carcer Tullianum, la prigione di mass: Carcer Tullianum: the maximum security prison of ancient Rome where enemies of state were imprisoned; Colosseum: where cruel games of Imperial Rome were held; Roman Forum: the social, commercial and religious hub of ancient Rome from the first pages of its history; Palatine Hill, place where this city was born around the middle of the eighth century BC.

u2799.Basilica di S. Maria in Via Lata: Basilica Santa Maria in Via Lata

u28a1.Le Catacombe sono “un mondo segreto che: The Catacombs are “a secret world that opens to pilgrims and tourists a world of artistic beauty and of faith in memory of so many people that believed in Christ and in his word of hope”.

u2661.Le Catacombe di Roma sono caratterizzate: The Catacombs of Rome are a network of tunnels carved out of tuff, at times on several levels. As you progress through this network of corridors, rooms and underground halls, you will be inevitably taken in not only by evocative scenes both from the Bible and from every day life in Rome, but also by a world of symbols, some of which are painted as frescoes, others which are carved into the stone as graffiti.

u2fe4.App audioguida multilingue per la Basili: Multi-language audioguide app for Saint Peter's Basilica

u2f2a.Roma, cuore della Cristianità, è una cit: Rome is not only a city laden with historical charm, museums, and churches, but it's the very heart of Christendom.
u2f2a.Se vuoi organizzare la tua visita in man: An Omnia Card will help you optimize your experience in Rome, making it that much more simple to organize your visits in an inexpensive manner.
u2f2a.In funzione del tempo a tua disposizione: According to the amount of time you have to spend, you can choose between the 24h card and the 72h card, both of which include a number of services.

u2f71.Ingresso Carcer Tullianum con supporto m: Entrance to Carcer Tullianum (Mamertine prison) with multimedia support

u2f87.Basilica di San Giovanni in Laterano e C: Basilica of Saint John Lateran and Cloister, with an audio guide and entry to the Museum of the Treasury

u2ffc.Ingresso Carcer Tullianum con supporto m: Entrance to Carcer Tullianum with multimedia support

u3014.Basilica di San Giovanni in Laterano e C: Basilica of Saint John Lateran and Cloister, with an audio guide and entry to the Museum of the Treasury

u302c.Ingresso ai sotterranei della Basilica d: Entrance to the underground crypt of the Basilica of Santa Maria in Via Lata

u3043.Se il tuo soggiorno a Roma è breve, sceg: If your stay in Rome is a short one, you can choose the Omnia Card 24 hours to accompany your unforgettable experience, allowing you to discover the treasures of Rome with numerous concessions and favorable conditions.

u313f.Roma Pass (solo per il titolo adulto): Rome Pass (included in the adult fee)

u2f9d.Un ingresso a scelta tra le Catacombe di: Entrance of your choice to one of the Catacombs of Rome

u2fb4.Rendi il tuo soggiorno a Roma un’esperie: Your stay in Rome can become an unforgettable experience using the Omnia Card 72 hours. In addition to offering a wide choice of Vatican&Rome services, you also get a “Rome Pass”, the card of the city of Rome that gives access to over 40 archaeological sites and museums within the city as well as to public transportation (both subway and buses).

u297c.CASA DEL VESCOVO DI ROMA: HOME OF THE BISHOP OF ROME

u2a17.Tutti i giorni tranne mercoledì, domenic: Every day except Wednesday, Sunday and religious holidays

u2b8d.Chiostro della Basilica di San Giovanni: Cloister of the Basilica of Saint John Lateran

u2992.Il Palazzo Lateranense, sede papale e re: The Lateran Palace was the official residence of the popes for many centuries. Considering its history, it has a lot to offer from an artistic, cultural and religious point of view. Here each room you visit has frescoed vaults, magnificent ceilings, fine tapestries, and paintings by great masters. You can also find fine antique furniture, for example in the private Papal apartment. This visit is an opportunity to experience and learn about both the history of the Church and that of the city of Rome. Quite a bit to appreciate from the Lateran Palace!

u2cbd.Un percorso autentico nel cuore della Ci: An authentic journey into the heart of the City. You'll be able to hop on and off at any of the stops along the way, strategically placed in the most interesting areas of the city. A multi-language audio guide will assist in enriching your knowledge of Rome's history and of its wonders.
u2cbd.La città di Roma è un museo a cielo aper: The city of Rome is an open air museum, which you can explore in relaxation while you take in the amazing view, on board the Vatican&Rome Open Bus.

u2e53.Omnia è la City Card di Roma e della Cit: Omnia is the City Card of Rome and Vatican City: with museums, monuments, transportation, priority entry and a plethora of other advantages, all in a single card.

u2e01.Omnia Vatican & Romeè l’unico pass uffic: Omnia Vatican&Rome is the only official pass to see Rome and the Vatican

u13e1.I Giardini Vaticani occupano circa due t: The Vatican Gardens occupy about two thirds of the surface area of Vatican City. The Popes have come to relax and meditate here since the year 1279 AD. You can admire the natural beauty and architectural wonders of the Vatican Gardens with a guided visit. Or, you can choose to have your visit in an unprecedented and sustainable fashion: on board a panoramic minibus where the silence of the "green heart" of the Vatican will permeate an evocative tour along paths of art, nature, and faith.

u10c0.I Musei Vaticani, da sempre considerati: You will be surprised by the cultural treasures that can be found in the Vatican Museums, which have always been considered one of the most important museum institutions in the world. Not only can you visit the exclusive art collections, archaeological artefacts, and items of ethnographic interest, but you can also visit some of the more significant areas of the Apostolic Palaces which contain some of the most famous artistic masterpieces of all times and some of the greatest treasures of the past.

u1363.<a id=\"u6ac5\" title=\"PRENOTA LA TUA V: RESERVE YOUR VISIT

u16db.Incantevoli in qualsiasi periodo dell’an: Enchanting at any time of the year, the Pontifical Villas of Castel Gandolfo are a unique balance between nature and art. Come appreciate the treasures that the Gardens of the Pontifical Villas offer. Together with Villa Cybo and Villa Barberini, the Castel Gandolfo Residence forms the complex of Pontifical Villas with their splendid gardens and marvelous park.
u16db.Sarà inoltre possibile ammirare il Palaz: Admire the Apostolic Palace, which for centuries was used as a summer residence of the Popes, and is now a museum. Take a journey through time as you admire the paintings, the relics, the liturgical garb and the uniforms.

u3252.Vivi Roma attraverso le sue strade e vic: Experience Rome in all its nooks and crannies

u32bd.Lontano dal clamore dei siti più conosci: Far from the clamor of the more famous sites, you can also discover a less well known Rome with hidden corners and alternate routes compared to the traditional ones. Take a stroll to discover hidden jewels both in and around the city center. Hear stories and untold peculiarities about churches, museums, districts, parks, basilicas, basements and terraces.

u334e.Nel cuore di Roma si intrecciano luoghi: In the heart of Rome, artistic beauty and spiritual afflatus join together.
u334e.La visita ripercorrerà le testimonianze: Retrace the steps traced in ages past by the Roman Emperors, discover the traces left by the Christian martyrs, and follow in the footsteps of so many Saints who have walked before us in these same streets. Contemplate the stories of the Gospel and of those who put it into practice in a heroic manner, as told by the works of art and by the architectural masterpieces.

u3590.Roma è custode anche della memoria di av: Rome preserves the memory of Gospel events through so many relics kept in various basilicas and churches. Discover the most significant Christian relics along a path that starts at the Basilica of Holy Cross in Jerusalem and ends at the Basilica of Saint Mary Major. Relive events from the life of Jesus and of the Apostles. Get a taste of the Holy Land here in Rome, in anticipation of an actual pilgrimage to the places of the Gospel in the Holy Land.

u37cb.L’itinerario pone l’attenzione su alcune: The focus of this itinerary is on those icons revered over the centuries by the Roman people, that are among the oldest extant icons in the world, and are often considered to have somewhat of a miraculous nature, or to tell a story that is none less than miraculous. Take a journey through faith and devotion. As objects of devotion, the icons have been carried in procession, invoked for healing, and still today are a living memory of Mary, Mother of us all, and of Jesus, son of God and son of Mary. At Santa Maria in via Lata, we will remember Saint Luke who dwelled there, and who was the first iconographer in history. At Santa Maria in Aracoeli, we will invoke the Madonna Advocata. At Santa Francesca Romana we will pay homage to the oldest known marian icon, “Our Lady of Comfort”. And last but not least, we will meet the patroness of Rome, Mary “Salus Populi Romani” in the Basilica of Saint Mary Major, whom the Popes themselves greet before and after their journeys abroad.

u19bb.La magnifica facciata del ‘700 di Carlo: The magnificent 18th century façade by Carlo Maderno and the Colonnade by Bernini symbolically embrace pilgrims arriving in the Eternal City. The embrace of Saint Peter's Basilica welcomes you for your visit as you come and discover the endless history of faith and charitable works.
u19bb.Attraverso un percorso di arte, fede e s: Admire not only the magnificence of the building and the beauty of the artwork, but come follow along a path of faith and spirituality. As you walk through the naves of the Basilica, stop to visit the side chapels and listen to the Gospel message that the works of art convey. As for example Michelangelo's Pietà, which not only is a masterpiece of all time, but also assists us in contemplating the Paschal mystery.

u39ab.Non si può immaginare Roma senza la comu: There is no imagining Rome without the Jewish community. Already in the second century, the community had settled between Trastevere and the opposite bank, where the Ghetto was established in the 16th century. A corner of the Eternal City where the most important memories of the Roman Jewish tradition are preserved. In the Portico of Octavia we remember the Roman period, in Piazza delle Cinque Scole the synagogues the rituals of which were forged by Jews from different countries, and in front of the Great Temple we witness the vitality of today's community. We will see traces of the forced isolation that this community suffered under the Nazi-fascist persecution. A thought provoking journey that calls to mind dramatic and painful stages of history.

u3eca.Fontana dei Quattro Fiumi: The Fountain of the Four Rivers

u3db2.Percorrendo gli argini del Tevere a bord: Traveling along the banks of the Tiber aboard a boat, explore Rome from a unique viewpoint. Then on board the Vatican&Rome Open Bus admire Rome with a view from above. With the support of a guide, discover fountains such as the Fountain of the Four Rivers in Piazza Navona, the Trevi Fountain and many less well known fountains hidden in various corners of the city. An extraordinary journey in which to experience the city in a unique way.

u438f.Obelisco Vaticano, Obelisco Piazza Navon: Vatican Obelisk, Piazza Navona Obelisk, Pantheon Obelisk, Santa Maria Sopra Minerva Obelisk

u43bc.Obelisco Montecitorio, Obelisco Piazza d: Montecitorio Obelisk, Piazza del Popolo Obelisk, Pincio Obelisk, Piazza Trinità dei Monti Obelisk

u43e9.Obelisco Quirinale, Obelisco Dogali,Obel: Quirinal Obelisk, Dogali Obelisk, Saint Mary Major Obelisk, Saint John Lateran Obelisk, Villa Celimontana Obelisk

u433b.Tra i tanti primati che possiede Roma c’: Among Rome's world records, we can count the highest concentration of obelisks in the world. Both Egyptian and Roman obelisks soar high in the Roman sky among the streets and squares of Rome. If they were a religious symbol for the Egyptians, for the Romans they became a symbol of power, victory and supremacy.
u433b.Fu durante il Rinascimento che gli obeli: During the Renaissance the obelisks represented an element of artistic and architectural expression, and began to constitute a Christian symbol of upsurge towards God, reason for which they were placed nearby the great Christian Basilicas.

u47c9.Il quartiere Ostiense, anche se consider: The Ostiense neighborhood, even if considered an area outside the city center that has degraded over time, did however play an important role both as an ancient access to the city in connection to the port of Ostia, and as a point of reference for artistic and social activities.
u47c9.L’itinerario metterà in evidenza l’impor: Witness the rise of the first industrial district of Rome, as well as the consequent redevelopment of industrial buildings which were transformed into cultural spaces. Such is the story of the Montemartini power plant, the first public plant in Rome for the production of electrical power.

u4962.Quartiere Ostiense & la Centrale Montema: The Ostiense Neighborhood and the Montemartini Power plant

u4c61.Il Parco degli Acquedotti è un luogo mol: The Park of the Aqueducts is a very lively place. The aqueducts were a masterpiece of engineering in ancient times, requiring a precision in their inclination down to the centimeter in order to succeed in bringing water into the city. The park has always been considered one of the green lungs of the city, a pleasant destination for taking a stroll amidst ancient Roman ruins.

u4d10.I resti della Villa delle Vignacce con l: The remains of the Villa delle Vignacce with the cistern

u55b6.sulle tracce di romolo e remo: on the trail of romulus and remus

u53d4.La nostra città è ricca di storie e pers: Our city is full of stories and characters that intertwine over time… why not get to know them by playing a game? Kids will be involved in a visit along via dei Fori Imperiali, with an interactive historical themed treasure hunt. They will solve puzzles, overcome tests and go in search of clues that they will find along the way: an adventure filled story full of action as well as culture and typical traditions of ancient Rome.

u5537.L’itinerario condurrà alla scoperta di v: A way of discovering the history behind Via dei Fori Imperiali, the Colosseum and the places of ancient Rome.

u6296.Emettiamo biglietteria ferroviaria, aere: We issue railway, air and sea tickets; specifically, we offer discounted prices and concessions up to 50% off of High Speed, Freccia Rossa/Freccia Argento trains.

u62f0.Il nostro staff qualificato e multilingu: Our fully qualified and multilingual staff guarantee continuous and attentive assistance all through your stay.

u62c3.Ci occupiamo della prenotazione di trasf: We take care of making reservations for private transportation by bus, car and open bus, with loyal companies that guarantee the best security and flexibility.

u643b.Arte, spiritualità, storia, cultura, nat: Art, spirituality, history, culture, nature and food-tasting are a few of the ingredients that you can choose from, so as to turn your visit in Rome into a unique experience.
u643b.Una variegata selezione di proposte e vi: A varied selection of proposals and visits for a weekend with the family, a holiday with friends, or a group visit will contribute to rediscovering the beauty of being together in a city of timeless charm.
u643b.Un’esperienza curata nei minimi dettagli: An experience with attention to the smallest details to provide ever new travel solutions, from accommodation to transfers with constant and attentive assistance.

u631e.Realizziamo e curiamo i contenuti di iti: We create exclusive itineraries and care for the contents of tailor-made experiences for individuals, families and groups.

u6377.a Roma e dintorni: in Rome and the surrounding area

u638d.Proponiamo soluzioni di pernottamento pr: We offer overnight accommodation in central or semi-central facilities with a wide choice of vacation homes and hotels, in order to tailor to different needs.

u63a4.Offriamo un’ampia scelta di proposte di: We offer all kinds of catering at selected facilities with the possibility of a box lunch and / or catering service at exclusive locations

u613d.Palazzo Apostolico & Ville Pontifice di: Apostolic Palace & Pontifical Villas of Castel Gandolfo

u608a.DI SANTA MARIA IN VIA LATA: OF SANTA MARIA IN VIA LATA

u6169.Basilica di santa maria in via Lata: Basilica Santa Maria in Via Lata

u617f.Open Bus in esclusiva: Exclusive use of the Open Bus

u5fef.Una “Location” insolita e autentica per: An unwonted and authentic Venue for an event “on the move” on board an Open Bus in the streets of Rome.

u5e43.Con una visita speciale all’interno del: With a special visit inside the Apostolic Palace, you will have the opportunity to admire some rooms that are generally not accessible: the Music Room and / or the Chapel of Urban VIII. The offer can be enriched by a visit to the Barberini Garden, which can be used in different ways: aboard a comfortable Golf Cart, with an ecological vehicle or in a traditional way thanks to a guided walk.

u5f01.La visita in questi siti spesso chiusi a: Delve into the past in an exclusive visit to the most important burial places of the first Christians, usually closed to the general public. A unique opportunity to experience underground Rome that would be otherwise almost impossible to experience.

u60a0.L’esperienza di visita a porte chiuse pe: Get to know the ancient underground rooms of the Basilica of Santa Maria in via Lata, a jewel of sacred art in the heart of Rome, with an exclusive visit behind closed doors.

u65e2.SUI PASSI DEGLI APOSTOLI: IN THE FOOTSTEPS OF THE APOSTLES

u667e.SUI PASSIDEGLI APOSTOLI: IN THE FOOTSTEPS OF THE APOSTLES

u676b.,CITTÀ FORTUNATA,INVINCIBILE ED ETERNA”: , A CITY THAT IS AUSPICIOUS, INVINCIBLE AND ETERNAL”

u64fa.siamo in grado di offrire a tutti i nost: we can offer our Friends an
u64fa.per visitare le più belle città della n: to visit the best cities of the Italian peninsula

u656c.Offerta base per partenze da Firenze, Na: Basic offer for departures from Florence, Naples, Genoa and Foggia to Rome. The offer can also be extended to other Italian cities, with the same formula of two way travel including an overnight stay. Priced on request.

u64cc.Tra tutti i mezzi di trasporto, il: Out of all the means of transportation, the

u64cc., potrai goderti il tuo viaggio rilassan: , you can enjoy your trip by relaxing and planning your days in the Eternal City…
u64cc.a tutto il resto ci pensiamo noi!: we will take care of the rest!
u64cc.Tornare ad organizzare un week-end è fin: Organizing a weekend is again within everyone's possibilities

u6511.L’offerta prevede un biglietto del treno: The offer includes a two way train ticket at a special price, as well as a night in a 3* hotel
u6511.(sistemazione in camera doppia con prima: (accommodation in a double room with breakfast).
u6511.Partenza da tutte le città collegate dal: Departures from all the cities that are connected to the railway network, to all of the artistic, naturalistic and historic centers in Italy, with at least one night in a hotel.

u3ffd.Con questo itinerario monografico andrem: Discover some of the incredible treasures that Rome preserves such as the ancient mosaics present in various churches. Starting at the Basilica of Saint Mary Major, with the cycle of marian mosaics from the fifth century, as well as those of the Triumphal Arch and the Apse, which eloquently testify to a Byzantine presence in Rome; and arriving at the Basilica of Santa Maria in Cosmedin, still officiated today with the Byzantine-Melkite rite as evidence of the ancient Oriental origins of the area.

u44b4.Seguendo i luoghi che hanno caratterizza: Retrace the history of Rome's political institutions from the republican era up to the period of fascism and the birth of the Italian Republic in 1946.
u44b4.Luoghi che hanno una bellezza ed una sto: Centuries-old historical places deserve to be known and appreciated in order to better understand the political identity of the city of Rome: a unique city that owes its intangible cultural heritage to this heterogeneous set of institutions and political realities.

u4bef.Ogni targa racconta una storia: Every plaque has a story to tell

u4bd9.A Roma sono nati in tanti, da Roma sono: Discover the countless commemorative plaques scattered throughout the center of town, commemorating specific people or events. In Rome many artists, writers, poets, and other significant people were born, or at least lived for some time. Great artists whom the city remembers "eternally" with marble plaques.

u4e00.In un piccolo paradiso lontano dai rumor: In a small paradise far from the noise of the city, admire the beauty of Villa Borghese and see the many transformations that it has undergone over the centuries. Splendid statues surrounded by greenery, luxuriant vegetation, the lake with its rich ecosystem will make for a pleasant visit painted with colors and imbued with floral scents.

u519f.I due leoni e la lupa capitolina: The two lions and the capitoline she-wolf

u5300.Via dei Coronari e Piazza San Salvatore: Via dei Coronari and Piazza San Salvatore

u5041.Attraverso un’attenta e curiosa osservaz: Through careful and curious observation of clues, kids and their families will become true hunters of art as they recreate a mini safari by catching reproductions of animals hidden along the streets of the historic center.
u5041.Un modo divertente, accattivante ed orig: A fun, captivating and original way to explore the city, learn about its history, its protagonists and the works of art. It will be a sort of role-playing game in which each child becomes a “story hunter”, with the ability to then pass these stories onto his or her peers.

u5633.percorsi dedicati, visite guidate, lettu: dedicated routes, guided visits, interpretation of art, manual workshops, creative areas and storytelling
u5633.grandi e piccini avranno la possibilità: both adults and kids will have the opportunity to learn about the history of the Torlonia family and about the residence outside the city walls which the princes had built.
u5633.Villa Torlonia è l’ultima grande villa s: Villa Torlonia is the last large suburban villa built in Rome and is the greatest testimony to the taste and ambitions of the wealthiest Roman family of the nineteenth century.

u57a4.Sarà un viaggio esperienziale alla scope: A journey of discovery of different architectural types in the villa: an ancient temple (
u57a4.), la casa dei figli del principe (: ), the house of the prince's sons (
u57a4.). La presenza di elementi naturalistici: ). The presence of natural and floral elements in the internal and external decorations give rise to the opportunity to learn not only about artistic aspects, but also about plantlife and nature.

u57dc.La Villa delle Meraviglie: Villa Torloni: The Villa of Wonders: Villa Torlonia

u3bd3.“Nullus agenti dies longus est” - nessun: “Nullus agenti dies longus est” - no day is long for those who work - said Seneca, and Rome has continued to work for millennia, maintaining in its traditions that uniqueness that has characterized not only its history, but also its social and urban planning. There are many streets dedicated to ancient crafts, many places where you can rediscover the flavors of both cultural and gastronomic tradition. A journey of discovery in the alleys of the center amidst art, history, Christianity, tradition and curiosity.

u5a95.LA CASA DEL VESCOVO DI ROMA: HOUSE OF THE BISHOP OF ROME

u5b79.Palazzo Lateranense, la Casa del Vescovo: Lateran Palace, house of the Bishop of Rome

u5919.La posizione a ridosso dell’area archeol: Being close to the archaeological area of the Imperial Forums confers a charm and uniqueness that help make the Carcer Tullianum a particularly prestigious venue for cultural events and exclusive private events.

u59ec.Le splendide sale riccamente decorate, i: Splendid richly decorated rooms, a well-kept courtyard and a strategic position a stone's throw from the Pantheon and Piazza Navona are aspects that mark the most important occasions with style and originality.

u5aab.In uno dei quartieri storici dell’Urbe,: The Lateran Apostolic Palace stands adjacent to the Basilica of Saint John Lateran, “Mater et Caput” of all the churches of Rome and the world, in one of the historic districts of the city. Frescoed vaults, magnificent ceilings, the charm and uniqueness of the rooms contribute to making private events hosted within even more exclusive.

u5c0c.Durante la visita notturna si avrà l’opp: During the night visit you will have the opportunity to immerse yourself in the unique atmosphere of the Vatican Museums, emphasized by the magic of the evening. Evening music concerts create a suggestive atmosphere.

u5ce1.Apri le porte dei Musei Vaticani insieme: Open the doors of the Vatican Museums together with the keyholder, the owner of all the 2797 keys of the Vatican! There are about ten “custodians” who take turns opening the wonderful rooms of the Vatican Museums to the public every day.

u5dc5.Musei vaticani & Cappella Sistina - Aper: Vatican Museums & Sistine Chapel - Nighttime opening with aperitif

u5daf.Musei Vaticani & Cappella Sistina - Alba: Vatican Museums & Sistine Chapel - Sunrise with the Keyholder

u421a.Sostenibilità, Solidarietà e Spiritualit: Sustainability, Solidarity and Spirituality are the keywords to attract the younger generation to the most famous but less known City of the world

u41b7.Le iniziative intendono proporre ai giov: The initiatives intend to offer young people, families, students and teachers a training model aimed at discovering our cultural, historical, artistic, religious and environmental heritage in a responsible way.
u41b7.Visitare, riflettere, conoscere e scopri: Visiting, reflecting, discovering and learning are things that cannot be held back from the younger generation.

u6214.Vivi con noil’esperienza di Romain uno o: Live your experience of Rome with us for one or more days

u61d2.La sua bellezza senza tempo e lo stupore: Its timeless beauty and the amazement that the Eternal City generates in each of us. Its uniqueness lies precisely in the central role it has historically played and we can breathe its entire history by walking through its streets, visiting its monuments and discovering the most hidden places. We will visit what are considered the symbols of the city, an expression of culture, Christianity, history and tradition, getting lost in and letting ourselves be carried away by the charm of the era that was.

u582c.Visite private,aperture straordinarie,ev: Private visits, extraordinary openings, private events

u585b.Eventi di solidarietà e di beneficenza,: Solidarity and charity events, exclusive guided tours, conferences, conventions, readings and concerts prepared with attention to the smallest details and customized according to specific needs.
u585b.Location di prestigio e proposte di visi: Prestigious venues and exclusive and authentic tours, enriched by dinners and food and wine tastings, will make for a unique and unforgettable experience.
u585b.Opera Romana Pellegrinaggi vanta una lun: Opera Romana Pellegrinaggi boasts a long experience in organizing events, contributing to the enhancement of the immense artistic heritage of the city of Rome and the Vatican.

u6d2.L’ORP, attraverso i pellegrinaggi, da ol: ORP has been carrying out a precious pastoral service for over 85 years, accompanying hundreds of thousands of faithful to the shrines of Lourdes and Fatima, to the Holy Land, to Turkey, to Santiago de Compostela and to many other places and countries in Europe and in the world.
u6d2.OMNIA Vatican & Rome nasce dall’esperien: OMNIA Vatican&Rome was born from the decades-long experience of Opera Romana Pellegrinaggi (ORP), an activity of the Diocese of Rome which was founded in 1933 to accompany Italian and foreign pilgrims along the journeys of the Spirit in Italy and around the world, offering adequate spiritual and technical-organizational assistance.

u714.Nel 2007 ORP ha creato Roma Cristiana, u: In 2007 ORP created Roma Cristiana, a specialized structure dedicated to welcoming visitors from all nations, languages and religious beliefs to the Eternal City, providing tour services to the main places of history, art and spirituality in the city of Rome.
u714.In questo contesto è nato, in collaboraz: In this context, the OMNIA Vatican & Rome project was born in collaboration with Roma Capitale and the Zètema Cultural Project. OMNIA is an card with integrated services that allow you to visit the most beautiful sites of the city: Vatican Museums, Sistine Chapel, Saint Peter's Basilica, Colosseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill, Basilica of Saint John Lateran and Cloister, also giving access to transportation on the Vatican & Rome Open Bus and on public transportation in the city.

Monday to Saturday, 9 AM to 5 PM

ufab.Scopri con noi i luoghidella Roma Cristi: Discover the must see places of Christian Rome together with us

uffd.“Roma è la capitale del mondo! In questo: “Rome is the capital of the world. The entire history of the world is tied to this city, and I believe I was born a second time, I believe I was truly risen, the day I set foot in Rome. Its beauties have gradually raised me up to their own heights.”
